intro: Anarthria gracilis var. complanata, commonly known as the flatleaf anarthria, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves that are typically flat and narrow, giving it its common name. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are usually greenish-white in color, which bloom during the spring and early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
